name: market for mine infrastructure, bauxite | mine infrastructure, bauxite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6885/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'mine infrastructure, bauxite', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of a mine infrastructure, bauxite. The mine is used for bauxite mining. It is assumed to have a lifetime of 20 years and a yearly output of 1,000,000 tons. The process include infrastructure and their decommission (buildings with their land use and machines), but it does not include the land use for the mine itself nor that for the roads in the mine.

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Minerals
